authors.author: Henry S. Coffin John M. Neale Thomas Helmore

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Rejoice! Rejoice! Emmanuel, newline Shall come to thee, O Israel!

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: O come, O come Emmanuel newline And ransom captive Israel, newline That mourns in lonely exile here newline Until the Son of God appear.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: O come, thou Wisdom from on high, newline And order all things far and nigh; newline To us the path of knowledge show newline And cause us in her ways to go.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: O come, O come, great Lord of might, newline Who to Thy tribes on Sinai's height newline In ancient times once gave the law newline In cloud and majesty and awe.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: O come, thou Root of Jesse's tree, newline An ensign of Thy people be; newline Before Thee rulers silent fall; newline All peoples on Thy mercy call.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: O come, thou Key of David, come, newline And open wide our heavenly home. newline The captives from their prison free, newline And conquer death's deep misery.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: O come, thou Dayspring, come and cheer newline Our spirits by Thy justice here; newline Disperse the gloomy clouds of night, newline And death's dark shadows put to flight.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: O come, Desire of nations bind newline All peoples in one heart and mind. newline From dust Thou brought us forth to life; newline Deliver us from earthly strife.
